alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 08 at 12:11PM PST until January 09 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 45 to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Northeast Foothills and Motherlode Counties. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 2 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Saturated soils will allow for trees to topple more easily during this wind event. The strongest winds will be overnight tonight. Strongest winds will be in the southern Sacramento Valley and northern San Joaquin Valley.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
